Column Comment.0: STRATIGRAPHIC ACQUISITION METHOD ID: unique identifier for the method usedin stratigraphic acquisition.
Column Comment.1: STRATIGRAPHIC ACQUISITION DATE: the date that the method was employed.
Column Comment.2: STRATIGRAPHIC ACQUISITION METHOD: the method that was used to arrive atthe stratigraphic analysis of data. May include Biostratigraphy, Radiographictechniques, cuttings, cores, logs, seismic etc.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: FIELD STATION ID: unique identifier for the stratigraphic field station.
Column Comment.7: INTERPRETATION IDENTIFIER: added to enable a single strat unit to be identifiedmore than once as part of a stratigraphic column. Multiple occurances may occur formany reasons, including folding, faulting or a non-vertical interpretation of the stratcolumn.
Column Comment.8: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.9: REMARK: narrative remarks about the methodology used for the acquisition of astratigraphic section or interpretation.
Column Comment.10: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.11: STRATIGRAPHIC COLUMN ID: The ID assigned to the stratigraphic column.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: STRAT NAME SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the stratigraphic name set. Astratigraphic name set is an unordered collection of stratigraphic units, that may be inuse for a Lexicon, a geographic area, a project, a company etc.
Column Comment.14: STRATIGRAPHIC UNIT IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the stratigraphic unit.
Column Comment.15: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.16: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.18: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.20: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
